title.native: ツルネ ―風舞高校弓道部―

description:
Minato played Japanese archery in middle school, but after a certain incident, he ran away from the sport. In high school, Minato meets new friends, and together as part of their school's archery club they aim to win the prefectural tournament.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

node.description: Yamamura Takuya is an animator and director working for Kyoto Animation.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

Harumi Fuuki is a Japanese composer and pianist affiliated with Inspire Holdings. She graduated from a national music college in the composition department as the top student.

Her works include music for television dramas, movies, commercials, stage plays, radio programs and anime.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Animator and character designer affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.
Yamamura Takuya is an animator and director working for Kyoto Animation.

Yasuhiro Takemoto studied animation at the Yoyogi Animation Academy. After graduating, he started working at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation) for almost his entire animation career, joining the company in 1996. At the company, Yasuhiro was considered one of the most reliable and trustworthy members of the staff. [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/) was his directorial debut​ and [Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/Full-Metal-Panic-Fumoffu/) his first solo directorial debut.

He died in the arson attack at Kyoto Animation's Studio 1 on July 18, 2019.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
Tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

Affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/236110/)._
Yamamura Takuya is an animator and director working for Kyoto Animation.
Animator and character designer affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)
